text: あ、ですねすみませんほんとだ
flow じゃなくて follow か
message別にいらんけど、まぁふいに打ったタグじゃなくてそれなりに意識的に打ったタグは大事だろうから一緒にpushしてやらんこともない、くらいのオプションなのか

```Tag objects (created with -a, -s, or -u) are called "annotated" tags; they contain a creation date, the tagger name and e-mail, a tagging message, and an optional GnuPG signature. Whereas a "lightweight" tag is simply a name for an object (usually a commit object).
Annotated tags are meant for release while lightweight tags are meant for private or temporary object labels. For this reason, some git commands for naming objects (like git describe) will ignore lightweight tags by default.```

```$ git config --global push.followTags
true
$ git tag foo-1
$ git push
Everything up-to-date
$ git tag -a foo-2
hint: Waiting for your editor to close the file... 
Setting up watches.
Watches established.
/tmp/tmp.7B9mAFEWfN MODIFY 
$ git push
Enumerating objects: 1, done.
Counting objects: 100% (1/1), done.
Writing objects: 100% (1/1), 159 bytes | 159.00 KiB/s, done.
Total 1 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
To <https://github.com/kyoh86-tryouts/test>
 * [new tag]         foo-2 -> foo-2```
正解…
npm publishしたあとのtagは自動でくっついていくからもしやそれか？

知らなかった。いつも、個別に `git push --tags`
効くんかねえ

pushしたrefから辿れるtagも一緒にpushと読めるんですけどね。
```       --follow-tags
           Push all the refs that would be pushed without this option, and also push annotated tags in refs/tags that are missing
           from the remote but are pointing at commit-ish that are reachable from the refs being pushed. This can also be specified
           with configuration variable push.followTags. For more information, see push.followTags in git-config(1).```
--flow-tags って、どこで使うオプションですか。git tagのオプションでもないし。ググると git flowのつかいかたのノイズが酷かった。
--flow-tagsって効くんだろうか…効いたことがない
